body: @gianm i see that this PR allows you to know host and port of peons from runningTask HTTP endpoint at overlord. so, in tranquility, you would use same to find the tasks . however realtime indexing task open a separate chat handler port which you do not obtain from the "TaskLocation" . are you planning to continue using service discovery for finding the chat handler port or should the TaskLocation be updated to have some kind of metadata object inside it too so that it can have additional information like chat handler port?
hold on, trying something out.

@himanshug that's a good point, I was thinking that the chat handler was still on the same port as the main servlet, but that's not true anymore since the separateIngestionEndpoint was added.

ideally this should be part of the location as well. will adjust that.

@himanshug I don't think v8 should support Integer/Double either. We shouldn't do unnecessary things.  But, It would be good to have a way to prevent some others from regarding the same thing like @navis mentioned.
@drcrallen @xvrl adjusted
@himanshug reopened with chatPort included.
@himanshug Rebased on master and revived some tests for off heap indexer.
@navis any chance we can finish this up? i only have a minor comment about adding a serde test
@nishantmonu51 @navis
Ah, forgot to ask to squash commits :P
This has transient failures in the new UT. Please please try to reduce transient failures.
@xvrl ?
@fjy missed your comment. I'll address that.
@fjy Yes, I think we can use TopNQuery for that purpose but select query can do that more effectively without making cursors.

@fjy Union datasource is basically for sending identical query to multiple datasources and merging them. But this is for sending different query for each datasoures. This is needed for datasources with different dimension names but should be merged into single result by aliasing dimension from datasources to identical name. 

For example we have ds1 with dim1,dim2,metric and ds2 with dim_1,dim_2,metric (yes strange, but it's required and we cannot change it) and need to group by the metric with ds1.dim1 and ds2.dim_1. #2349 is related to this (aliasing part).
It's more about memory not performance but I'll try.

I've opened a PR that adds initial support for numeric dimensions (no indexing):
https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2442
Adding 100M int[2] into tmpFile took 12749 msec with this and 15110 msec in trunk. But I don't think this means any performance boost by this.

Notice that jets3t is on there twice, once for spark and once for the aws credentials.

Thank you for the comments.
I updated based on the comments and rebase/squashed.
The challenge here is that it is not obvious that jets3t SHOULDN'T be used until it is trying to be in both classloaders at once. I'll see if I can reproduce this locally.
@gianm all comments addressed
Or maybe its this? http://bugs.java.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=8006684
does anyone know why https://travis-ci.org/druid-io/druid/jobs/108405468 is failed even if all tests passed?
:+1: once https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2425/files#r52565204 is resolved . pls squash the commits after you're done.
this was a problem with selfcontained jar

Marked WIP because need modification on DimensionsSpec to accept per dimension configuration. With 2K cache (About 0.5MB`=2K*2K/2*2bit` for each dimension), got 5~10 % performance enhancement of on-heap ingestion.

squashed all commits.
@drcrallen more comments ?
+1, I think this is ready to be merged. docs can be added in the follow up PR.

@b-slim I'm still not sure about https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2291#discussion-diff-52407458R74 and if changing the default from false to true is going to be problematic. I'd like a second opinion from one of the other committers (maybe @cheddar since he's already in this PR) and will stand by whichever way they decide.  :+1: after second opinion.
@turu Nice Catch.
This issue wins bug report of the year
@drcrallen if [https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2291#discussion-diff-52407458R74] is a blocker i will reverted and send a separate PR to make it true by default. What do you think ?
awesome :+1:

Fwiw, I think that given that the lookups are still pretty experimental, the change from the default to optimize doesn't seem so bad to me.  The worst risk is that the optimization is broken and it breaks people who move up to this version.  

Hopefully their tests will show that it is broken and we will have a chance to fix before it's too horrible.  So, given the risks and the fact that this is experimental, I'm fine with the change.
cool, :+1:  then

:+1:  (pls squash the commits)

@zhaown would you like to take a look at this one?
this PR was against the wrong branch...
@drcrallen and @cheddar thanks for the review i will merge after build pass.!

We really need to fix these transient failures:
https://github.com/druid-io/druid/issues/2451
@jon-wei this is failing UT

@b-slim I am not so familiar with Graphite, can you confirm that the Graphite emitter is intended to be used in conjunction with the carbon aggregator on the Graphite side.  I.e. if you send metrics like "query.time.{datasource}.{type}" but leave off all the other dimensions, you then use Graphite's Carbon Aggregator to produce an average of points with this prefix.  Is this correct? The dimension selection going on in the GraphiteEmitter makes a lot of sense in this context.  However, I am not aware of support for this type of storage time aggregation with Ganglia.
:+1: after commits squashed
Still :+1: after commits squashed
:+1: after squash
:+1: looks good after squash
@turu awesome catch. Do you mind trying the @Ignore methods in HyperLogLogCollectorTest.java before and after the patch to verify performance?

@fjy thanks :).

Here are the results (avg from 3 runs on my machine) for the ignored long running tests in HyperLogLogCollectorTest.java:
**Before patch** (at current tip of master):
1. testHighCardinalityRollingFold - _62s 583ms_
2. testHighCardinalityRollingFold2 - _109s 594ms_
**After patch:**
1. testHighCardinalityRollingFold - _62s 882ms_
2. testHighCardinalityRollingFold2 - _109s 513ms_
Thanks for the awesome bug report @turu we don't get many of those. :+1: on merging this from my end.
squashed
@xvrl @gianm we should backport this
@gianm can we backport this?
Not yet decided if we remove `size` in the metadataquery but squashed anyway.
rebased
@navis we probably should wait until 0.10.0 to remove size, but I agree with Gian what it should actually return is the actual on disk size
@r4ruchir any luck with the CLA?

Perhaps related to this, I briefly experimented with integrating Apache Calcite with Druid as an SQL parser/query planner; I wasn't familiar with query planning and didn't pursue this very far.

Would it make sense to do union queries where the two datasources are both 'query' datasources? I believe right now 'query' datasources are limited (I think they only work for groupBy?) but it seems like something that potentially _could_ make sense.
@himanshug needs backport

@liqweed agree that Copycat does seem the farthest along of any embeddable JVM consensus system, I would love to hear if anyone has run it in production long enough to see if it can match ZK in reliability (ZK's record is not perfect but it's pretty good).

I'm not sure about other folks, but I was not really imagining this layer being pluggable, as that seems like more trouble than it's worth. I think in the long run we could merge the consensus system and the metadata store and have something that people are generally happy with and don't feel the need to plug in other solutions.
